title: Limonda
author: Limonda
content: Welcome to Coin Calendar  A New Tool for the Community.Our goal is to make a new tool to help small crypto teams be seen and an easy way for them to communicate and listen to their community.  What is Coin Calendar?Coin Calendar is a new and early project that will bring a new website that will feature and provide smaller crypto startups and projects with the opportunity to be heard. This will include dates for when there will be big updates within these smaller projects, a forum to discuss these update and projects, and overall just a good and smooth experience.   Coin Calendar Token   SALES ARE LIVEWe are currently raising funds threw a BSC token, $CCD, which we will use towards development and marketing to help us grow. Eventually you will be able to use $CCD as a currency on the website we're making as a utility token used as payment for promotion or upvoting projects.· 100% of the liquidity is locked· 5% tax for buy/sell· 1.5% goes to development · 1.5% goes to marketing· 2% is burned· 50,000,000 max supply  Links  Come check us out!Discord: https://discord.gg/nYqErxvQH8Twitter: https://twitter.com/CoinCalendar_Telegram: https://t.me/+5ggptgBYiaVjNTBhPancakeswap: https://pancakeswap.finance/swap?inputCurrency=0x680A501eA4545C0Fb18827EBCBcf9B645469abd5&outputCurrency=BNBPoocoin: https://poocoin.app/tokens/0x680a501ea4545c0fb18827ebcbcf9b645469abd5

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Quote from: Limonda on August 09, 2023, 10:25:51 PMWelcome to Coin CalendarA New Tool for the Community.Our goal is to make a new tool to help small crypto teams be seen and an easy way for them to communicate and listen to their community.We already have Telegram its free and popular what features will your platform have that will look better than Telegram?QuoteWhat is Coin Calendar?Coin Calendar is a new and early project that will bring a new website that will feature and provide smaller crypto startups and projects with the opportunity to be heard. This will include dates for when there will be big updates within these smaller projects, a forum to discuss these update and projects, and overall just a good and smooth experience. What do we need a token for it's easy to create a forum like an SMF, people trust Bitcointalk more than any other forums I don't think you will need crowdfunding to launch a forum if this is the only features that you can come out with I don't think it will attract investors.

comments.author: www.Gambler.Casino
comments.body: Start your service. Why raise money for this?

comments.author: MAAManda
comments.body: What kind of bullshit is this? if you want to create your service, you can create it independently without any connection to the token sale. After all, what utility can this project provide to the token holders? is the utility available only to developers who want their project to be heard by the crypto public?IMO, before you make a project, it's a good idea for you to do your due diligence first regarding whether this project will be useful to people, whether this project has strong competitors and so on. After all, for now we have a calendar for a much longer known crypto project like Coinmarketcal.

comments.author: nur1labs
comments.body: did you post wrong room i think need put on ann not here. then what for project like this. we have already telegram community and bot make easy.

comments.author: BTCZtothemoon
comments.body: We arent raising money for if i wanted to launch a normal forum I would. Im working with web3 developers on a lot more than just a forum. Maybe join the discord and idk, ask questions before talking shit?Why would i lock $4000 in liquidity if i wanted a shitty forum like this one?Are you gonna pay my devs? Lmfao

comments.author: holydarkness
comments.body: Quote from: BTCZtothemoon on August 13, 2023, 11:01:39 AMWe arent raising money for if i wanted to launch a normal forum I would. Im working with web3 developers on a lot more than just a forum. Maybe join the discord and idk, ask questions before talking shit?Why would i lock $4000 in liquidity if i wanted a shitty forum like this one?Are you gonna pay my devs? LmfaoTwo questions. One, if this forum is shitty, why do you bother asking for a fund raising here? And two, let's talk about the project itself. The forum already have and facilitate small crypto projects to be heard... as long as they're legit. How do you plan to be sure you're promoting the correct ones and not a scam projects?
